title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This analysis examines the relationship between life expectancy and population size.

# Import libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np

# dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

# scatter plot
scatter = sns.scatterplot(
    data=gapminder,
    x="population_millions",
    y="life_expectancy",
    hue="continent",
    size="gdp_per_capita",
    sizes=(20, 500),
    alpha=0.7
)

plt.xscale('log')

plt.xlabel('Population (millions, log scale)')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. Population Size by Country')

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
This analysis tracks the changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country over time.

# Import libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np

# dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

# i selected US for analysis
country_name = "United States"
country_data = gapminder[gapminder['country'] == country_name]

fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(12, 15), sharex=True)

# 1. Life Expectancy Over Time
sns.lineplot(
    data=country_data,
    x="year",
    y="life_expectancy",
    marker='o',
    color='blue',
    ax=axes[0]
)
axes[0].set_title(f'Life Expectancy in {country_name} (1952-2007)')
axes[0].set_ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
axes[0].grid(True)

# 2. GDP per Capita Over Time
sns.lineplot(
    data=country_data,
    x="year",
    y="gdp_per_capita",
    marker='o',
    color='green',
    ax=axes[1]
)
axes[1].set_title(f'GDP per Capita in {country_name} (1952-2007)')
axes[1].set_ylabel('GDP per Capita ($)')
axes[1].grid(True)

# 3. Population Over Time
sns.lineplot(
    data=country_data,
    x="year",
    y="population_millions",
    marker='o',
    color='red',
    ax=axes[2]
)
axes[2].set_title(f'Population in {country_name} (1952-2007)')
axes[2].set_xlabel('Year')
axes[2].set_ylabel('Population (millions)')
axes[2].grid(True)

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
This analysis tracks the changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country over time.

# Import libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np

# dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

# i selected US for analysis
country_name = "United States"
country_data = gapminder[gapminder['country'] == country_name]

fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(12, 15), sharex=True)

# 1. Life Expectancy Over Time
sns.lineplot(
    data=country_data,
    x="year",
    y="life_expectancy",
    marker='o',
    color='blue',
    ax=axes[0]
)
axes[0].set_title(f'Life Expectancy in {country_name} (1952-2007)')
axes[0].set_ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
axes[0].grid(True)

# 2. GDP per Capita Over Time
sns.lineplot(
    data=country_data,
    x="year",
    y="gdp_per_capita",
    marker='o',
    color='green',
    ax=axes[1]
)
axes[1].set_title(f'GDP per Capita in {country_name} (1952-2007)')
axes[1].set_ylabel('GDP per Capita ($)')
axes[1].grid(True)

# 3. Population Over Time
sns.lineplot(
    data=country_data,
    x="year",
    y="population_millions",
    marker='o',
    color='red',
    ax=axes[2]
)
axes[2].set_title(f'Population in {country_name} (1952-2007)')
axes[2].set_xlabel('Year')
axes[2].set_ylabel('Population (millions)')
axes[2].grid(True)

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
Analysis
The United States shows significant development across all three metrics from 1952 to 2007.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This analysis explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita across different countries and years.

# Import libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np

# dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

# scatter plot
scatter = sns.scatterplot(
    data=gapminder,
    x="gdp_per_capita",
    y="life_expectancy",
    hue="continent",
    size="population_millions",
    sizes=(20, 500),
    alpha=0.7
)

plt.xscale('log')

plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita (log scale)')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita (2007)')

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This analysis explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita across different countries and years.

# Import libraries
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import numpy as np

# dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

# scatter plot
scatter = sns.scatterplot(
    data=gapminder,
    x="gdp_per_capita",
    y="life_expectancy",
    hue="continent",
    size="population_millions",
    sizes=(20, 500),
    alpha=0.7
)

plt.xscale('log')

plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita (log scale)')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita (2007)')

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
Analysis
The scatter plot reveals a strong positive correlation between GDP per capita and life expectancy. Countries with higher GDP per capita tend to have longer life expectancies. The relationship appears to be logarithmic rather than linear, suggesting that increases in GDP have diminishing returns on life expectancy after a certain threshold.
